case_vignette: A 57-year-old man is brought to the physician for worsening mental status over the past 2 months. His wife reports he was initially experiencing lapses in memory and over the past 3 weeks he has begun having difficulties performing activities of daily living. Yesterday, he became lost heading to the post office down the street. He has hypertension treated with lisinopril and hydrochlorothiazide. Vital signs are within normal limits. He is alert but verbally uncommunicative. Muscle strength is normal. Reflexes are 2+ in bilateral upper and lower extremities. He has diffuse involuntary muscle jerking that can be provoked by loud noises. Mental status examination shows a blunt affect. A complete blood count and serum concentrations of glucose, creatine, and electrolytes are within the reference range.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having memory lapses and difficulty with everyday activities, and recently I got lost very close to my home.
How old are you?
I am 57 years old.
Do you have any history of similar symptoms in your family?
I don't have any information regarding similar symptoms in my family.
Have you noticed any changes in your mood or behavior recently?
Yes, I've been less expressive with my emotions recently.
Are you currently taking any medications?
Yes, I'm taking lisinopril and hydrochlorothiazide for my blood pressure.
Have you experienced any changes in your language ability, like trouble finding the right words to use?
I've become verbally uncommunicative recently.
Final Diagnosis: Alzheimer's disease.
